content: ez 100th anniversary pi shawl camping page 1 th ez 100 anniversary pi shawl camping elizabeth zimmermann was born on august 9th 1910 8/9/10 this shawl is one of a set of three shawls designed as a tribute to ez and a celebration of all she has done for us it is based on her wonderful pi shawl in her book knitter s almanac for the ez 100th anniversary pi shawls modifications have been applied so that the repeats stitches and rounds are multiples of 8 9 and 10 the numbers in ez s birthday thanks to fullcircle for the inspiration to use these numbers for the shawl in the photo i used 5mm needles and 1280 yards of fingering weight yarn the shawl was 64 163cm while blocking your experience may vary depending on yarn weight needle size and gauge use any yarn weight and needle size that you like you don t have to use the stitch patterns provided here you could unvent your own include any pattern that has stitch repeats of 8 9 or 10 the theme of the third design is the wonderful camping trips that ez describes in the knitter s almanac page 85 she describes being over 60 water camping and fishing in the canadian north woods spectacular there are other stories about camping by the mississippi dandled by the milky ripples of the river the opinionated knitter page 70 but my absolute favourite is about a camping trip on a remote island in northern canada in late september 1971 with elizabeth the old man and kline the cat the opinionated knitter pages 38 41 if you have never read this you simply must get hold of it camping with ez the paw prints in the centre of the shawl honour kline and all our furry companions the slanting twigs in the next ring represent a walk in the forest with sun shining through the trees the willow leaves in the outer ring celebrate the beauty of everything growing and green the waves and droplets edging represents water lapping at the edge of the lake or river and rolling back across the sand and rocks the first three stitch patterns are from the haapsalu shawl a knitted lace tradition from estonia modified for knitting in the round and the fourth stitch pattern is based on judy gibson s scalloped edging http //tiajudy com/scallopedge htm the other two shawls can also be found on ravelry ez 100th anniversary pi shawl gull wings ez 100th anniversary pi shawl hearts join our kal knit along on ravelry http //www ravelry com/discuss/10 shawl i like to use a long tail cast on using 2 circular needles cast on to one circular divide stitches over the 2 circulars and join to work in round
